recipes.name: Pad Thai
recipes.instructions:
1. Gather all ingredients required for pad thai, ensuring herbs, vegetables, proteins, and pastes are cleaned, measured, and prepared.
2. Prepare 200g Rice noodles by slicing, cleaning, marinating, or chopping it according to the traditional requirements of the dish.
3. Heat a wok or pot over medium to high heat, adding oil or coconut cream depending on the dish’s authentic preparation style.
4. Add aromatics such as garlic, chilies, shallots, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, or galangal and sauté until fragrant.
5. Add curry paste, seasoning pastes, or dry spices if the recipe uses them and fry briefly to release their essential oils.
6. Add the main ingredient and stir-fry or simmer until it begins to develop color or absorb the flavors of the aromatics.
7. Incorporate vegetables, herbs, or secondary proteins as required and toss or mix evenly.
8. Add liquids such as coconut milk, broth, tamarind water, or seasoning sauces and bring to a gentle boil.
9. Reduce heat and simmer until all ingredients are thoroughly cooked, flavors meld, and the sauce reaches desired consistency.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning using fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar, tamarind, or chili to balance sweet–sour–salty–spicy elements.
11. Add finishing touches such as Thai basil, coriander, fried garlic, roasted rice powder, or chili oil depending on the dish.
12. Serve hot with jasmine rice, sticky rice, fresh vegetables, or noodles as traditionally paired with the dish.

3. Heat a wok or pot over medium to high heat, adding oil or coconut cream depending on the dish’s authentic preparation style.
4. Add aromatics such as garlic, chilies, shallots, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, or galangal and sauté until fragrant.
5. Add curry paste, seasoning pastes, or dry spices if the recipe uses them and fry briefly to release their essential oils.
6. Add the main ingredient and stir-fry or simmer until it begins to develop color or absorb the flavors of the aromatics.
7. Incorporate vegetables, herbs, or secondary proteins as required and toss or mix evenly.
8. Add liquids such as coconut milk, broth, tamarind water, or seasoning sauces and bring to a gentle boil.
9. Reduce heat and simmer until all ingredients are thoroughly cooked, flavors meld, and the sauce reaches desired consistency.
10. Taste and adjust seasoning using fish sauce, lime juice, palm sugar, tamarind, or chili to balance sweet–sour–salty–spicy elements.
11. Add finishing touches such as Thai basil, coriander, fried garlic, roasted rice powder, or chili oil depending on the dish.
12. Serve hot with jasmine rice, sticky rice, fresh vegetables, or noodles as traditionally paired with the dish.
